Title: A Landscape Scene with a Young Man and an Old Man
Medium: ink and pigments on orange-tinted paper with bluish-green borders
Inscriptions: [Transliteration] tammat al-kitāb bi-'awn al-Mālik al-Wahhāb /1/ sawwadahu al-'abd al-aqall Muhammad Zamān al-Tabrīzī / 2/ sanah 998 /3/
Description: In this landscape scene from Walters manuscript W.651 a young man holding a sheet of paper containing a verse and an older man are seated next to a tree. The older man may be intended to represent the poet Jami. The colophon in Arabic gives the name of the calligrapher and date of copying.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Qajar; Book; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Iran; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Mahmud Askani, 1893-1894, by purchase [ownership statement on fol. 6b written by Husayn Qavam Daftar (?) and dated 1311 AH/AD 1893-1894 stating that this precious book was bought for his son Mahmud Askani from a woman for 10 ashrafis (gold dinars)]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Nur al-Din `Abd al-Rahman ibn Ahmad Jami (Persian, died 898 AH/AD 1492)
